Summary: The proposal aims to advance geometric deep learning by integrating geometric priors into GNNs to address limitations like limited expressive power, scalability issues, and geometric constraints. It proposes a three-pronged approach involving geometric GNNs, topological regularization, and efficient computation, with a detailed experiment plan covering synthetic and real-world benchmarks.
Strengths: Clear and well-motivated problem statement with relevant literature citations.
Comprehensive proposed method combining multiple innovative approaches.
Detailed and rigorous experiment plan including synthetic tasks, real-world benchmarks, and ablation studies.
Weaknesses: Lacks specific technical details on integrating geometric priors and curvature-aware message-passing.
Scalability claims are ambitious but not backed by concrete algorithmic innovations.
Experiment plan could benefit from more discussion on potential pitfalls and mitigation strategies.
Questions: Can you provide more technical details on how geometric priors will be integrated into the GNN architecture?
What specific algorithmic innovations will ensure the scalability of the proposed methods?
How will you address potential challenges in implementing curvature-aware message-passing?
Limitations: Potential technical challenges in integrating differential geometry with deep learning.
Scalability of the proposed methods on very large graphs may be limited by current hardware.
Dynamic graph modeling may introduce additional complexity and computational overhead.
